intro: Hieracium trichocephalum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, often with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium trichocephalum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
